title: General Motors' China Sales Rise 4.4% in First-Half 2015 - Analyst Blog
text: Content preferences Done General Motors Company GM and its joint ventures in China reported a 4.4% year-over-year increase in retail sales in the first half of 2015, taking the figure to 1,719,202 vehicles. The improved performance was driven by General Motors’ enhanced mix of SUVs and MPVs. General Motors and its joint ventures in China also reported solid performance in June with sales of 246,066 vehicles in the nation.General Motors’ retail sales of SUV models went up 82.7% to 148,081 units in the first half of 2015. The upside was supported by the delivery of 57,413 units of Buick Envision. Sales of MPV models increased 31.4% to 505,519 units, driven by higher sales of Baojun 730.General Motors offers a wide range of vehicles – from passenger to commercial – and varied brands in China. The different brands are Baojun, Buick, Cadillac, Chevrolet, Jiefang and Wuling.The Buick brand’s sales in China improved 4.3% to 436,226 units in the first half of 2015. The upside was driven by an increase in the combined sale of Excelle XT and GT which totaled 107,799 units. Cumulative sales of Buick’s SUVs Envision, Enclave and Encore increased more than double to 96,433 units. This marked the best first half for the Buick brand in China.Sales of Chevrolet improved 0.6%, taking the number to 317,408 units. The brand benefited from Cruze sales of 124,898 units. Meanwhile, sales of the Trax urban SUV grossed 27,967 units.Sales of the Cadillac luxury vehicle brand witnessed a 14% rise to 39,444 units in the first half of 2015. Sales volume of ATS-L and ATS was 14,158 units, while sales of the XTS sedan and SRX surpassed 12,000 units each.However, Wuling sales went down 5.5% in China to 764,172 units in the first half of 2015 while Baojun sales soared 308.5% to 159,511 units.General Motors is increasing capacity investment in emerging markets to recoup global sales and meet the growing demand. The automaker plans to launch new and refreshed models in the second half of 2015 in order to fulfill the diverse demand in China. In the second half, General Motors plans to launch Chevrolet Malibu sedan and Baojun 560 SUV. Moreover, the Buick Verano sedan, launched on Jun 27, will hit the showrooms China. The company will also step-up the domestic production of Buick Envision.General Motors – a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold) stock – is a leading global automotive company. It has eleven joint ventures and two wholly owned foreign enterprises, with more than 58,000 employees in China. The automaker expects industry demand in China to increase this year as well and hence, it will continue to expand its vehicle and service line-up.Better-ranked stocks in the auto industry include Meritor, Inc.
